intro: Adinandra trichocoryna var. stylosa, commonly known as the slender-leafed adinandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland rainforests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
